oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Crayon of James Washington Henderson
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This crayon print is of Pvt. James Washington Henderson, Co. F, 20th Tenn. Cav. Regt., CSA. He was a farmer from the Paris Landing area of Henry County, Tennessee. He enlisted September 20, 1863 and died at home while still in service on April 20, 1864. His service records list him as J.W. Henderson and indicate that he was 28 years old with blue eyes, light hair, light complexion and stood 5 feet 10 inches tall and died of "fever." The crayon print may have been created from a war time photograph.
